result.execSummary:
The defendant John Demarco Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John Demarco Butler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John Demarco Butler was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • John Demarco Butler was found guilty of Intentionally Point Firearm At Person [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).
  • John Demarco Butler was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • John Demarco Butler was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 5 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Concurrent.
Court notes 110 days credit against ultimate sentence.
Probation may be transferred to Minnesota.
Defendant may apply for expungement upon successful completion of Probation and DJOC Agreement.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF298.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF298.
Not to use or possess firearms.

-Defendant to obtain GED/HSED or equivalent.
-Defendant to set goals and return to the Court within 10 days.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-No Contact with M. Lott, K. Perry II or Gilbert Carothers.

***AMENDED***
Per Judge R. Michael Waterman May 24, 2018 - amend credit.

-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due. CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Andrea L Nemmers   DF:  John Demarco Butler appeared from jail. Case called at 10:34 a.m. Court notes this a continued hearing on sentencing after revocation. Atty Nemmers has more information today regarding the MN sentence. Gives argument. DE offers Exhibit's #1 & #2 (paperwork reflecting MN court cases). ADA Minser responds. Stands by States original sentencing recommendations. DE makes statement. Court finds DE is not entitled to sentence credit per the MN sentence. Court O/R Exhibit's #1 and #2. 
Court Orders on Ct. 5:
- Bifurcated Sentence of 2 years IC, 3 years ES. Consecutive to Ct's 2-4 already served.
- Eligible for SAP and CIP
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections
- Jail credit of 81 days
and Exhibits From 01-25-18 Sentencing Hearing on Revocation. hml

No corrections noted but a portion that is incomplete. Makes statement. ADA Minser makes sentencing arguments. State is in compliance with Victim notification. Atty Nemmers gives sentencing arguments. DE Exhibit #1 (partial transcript of MN Sentence). DE Exhibit #2 (motions and Exhibits on MN case). Court will continue matter to allow Atty Nemmers to collect information regarding MN Sentence. Court will O/R Exhibit's #1 & #2. Atty Nemmers to provide the State with any information at least a day in advance of next hearing.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for January 31, 2018 at 10:30 am.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Amber L Hahn, DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad, DF:  John Demarco Butler appeared from jail. Attorney Smestad recites agreement. DE pleads guilty to Ct 2 (possess THC); count 3 (class A misd. point firearm); count 4 (Misd. theft); and count 5 (theft - special facts). Crt reviews constitutional rights. Def understands. Court informs of charges, maximum penalty and consequences. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Cts 2, 3, 4 and 5. Enter judgment of conviction for 2, 3 and 4. Court withholds judgment of guilt in count 5 upon full compliance of deferred judgment. Crt dismisses count one. Sentencing recommendations. 

RE: Count 5 - DJOC. Court amends to a 30 month agreement. Bond continues and no firearm possession. Follow all rules of agreement. 

Court orders for counts 2, 3 and 4 (all counts concurrent): S/W 2 years probation with conditions: 

- Defendant to obtain GED/HSAD or equivalent 
- Defendant to set goals and return within 10 days to the Court.
- $243.00 in court costs for each count. Payable through probation
- $200.00 DNA surcharge. Payable through probation
- 10 days in St. Croix County Jail, each count - concurrent.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- No contact with M. Lott
- No contact with K. Perry II
- No contact with Gilbert Carothers.
- No use or possession of a firearm. 
110 days credit against ultimate sentence. 
Defendant may apply for expungement upon successful completion of probation/DJOC agreement.
Defendant is advised of right to appeal. 
Probation may be transferred to State of MN.

A  CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb. Includes case 14CF298 and 14CF299.  DA: Amber L Hahn, DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad, DF: John Demarco Butler appeared from jail.  DF ATTY: Daniel J. Chapman, DF: Gilbert Montrell Carothers appeared.  Court called at 1:24 p.m.  S/T Deputy Charles Coleman. Direct by ADA Hahn.  Defendants are identified.   Attorney Smestad objects for the record regarding hearsay answers.  Court overruled.  Cross by Attorney Smestad.  Cross by Attorney Chapman. Witness excused.  S/T Investigator Chris Drost.  Direct by ADA Hahn.  Cross by Attorney Smestad.  Cross by Attorney Chapman.  Witness excused.  Argument from ADA Hahn.  Argument from Attorney Smestad.  Argument from Attorney Chapman.  Court finds probable cause that a felony occured and binds the Defendants over for trial.  Attorney Smestead is requesting the bond to be amended to a signature bond.  Mr Butlers parents are present in the courtroom and Attorney Smestad requests the defendant's mother Eilean Johnson co-sign on the bond.  ADA Hahn objects.  The court questions Eileen Johnson. If Defendant's mother Eileen Johnson is willing to post $2,500 cash and $10,000 co-signature bond.  Court will amend.  Bond continues in form and amount. lw  Arraignment scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
for Bail Hearing. Filed by Atty Kucinski. km
Filed by Atty Smestad. km
Appointing Atty Smestad. km
Bail/bond hearing on August 5, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Atonio O., Michael R. or Kevin P.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
